thread.title: Entertainment: Nude scene and all, Jerry Hall heads to Sydney in The Graduate
thread.title_full: Entertainment: Nude scene and all, Jerry Hall heads to Sydney in The Graduate

author: Garry Maddox
title: Entertainment: Nude scene and all, Jerry Hall heads to Sydney in The Graduate
text:
As Mrs Robinson: Jerry Hall in The Graduate. Photo: Rob Kelly 
It's still 14 months away but Jerry Hall is bringing a farewell tour of The Graduate to Sydney.
The model and actress has been playing sultry Mrs Robinson, who seduces a young college graduate, around the world for more than a decade, including tours to Perth and Melbourne.
She is one of the producers of play, which opens at the Lyric Theatre on December 2 next year.
Heading to Sydney: Jerry Hall and Tim Dashwood in The Graduate. Photo: Jeff Busby 
Tim Dashwood will return as Ben Braddock, the role played by Dustin Hoffman opposite Anne Bancroft in Mike Newell's Oscar-winning film from 1967.
Advertisement "As it will be the last time I play this role it makes the Sydney season very special to me," said Hall, 59.
She was one of the actresses who took over from Kathleen Turner in the original stage production in London's West End in 2000, attracting headlines with a nude scene.
Final time in the role: Jerry Hall. Photo: Karon Photographry 
The NSW Minister for Trade, Tourism and Major Events, Stuart Ayres, said Destination NSW expected the show to deliver more than $1.6 million to the state's economy.
The production received tepid reviews when it ran in Melbourne two years ago, with The Age calling it "an uneven blend of undercooked comedy and overdone melodrama".
While saying there were "plenty of cheesy laughs", The Herald Sun described the show as "strangely unsatisfying â€“ and just a little bit tired".
The late Wendy Hughes played the role in a Sydney production that was a box office disappointment, closing three weeks ahead of schedule, in 2001.
